examples: Technology advances by fits and starts.
The study yielded significant findings that could advance medical research.
She booked a hotel room in advance to ensure she had a place to stay during her vacation.
The tennis player achieved a clean sweep of her matches, winning every set and advancing to the finals.
I lived on the edge using cash advances to pay one credit card with another until I finally found a job three months after graduation.
words.defineEn: to propose an idea or theory for discussion
words.defineVi: để đề xuất một ý tưởng hoặc lý thuyết để thảo luận

examples: Alternatively the point the universe is pretty freakin’ weird.
Alternatively, we could combine the water with more carbon dioxide from the atmosphere.
Alternatively, we could define a function where every numerical input corresponds to a different alphabetical output.
Alternatively, it could just be a random mutation.
Alternatively, you can search for them in the search bar.
words.defineEn: as a second choice or another possibility
words.defineVi: như một sự lựa chọn thứ hai hoặc khả năng khác

examples: My favorite smoothie recipe always includes the juiciness of a Jaffa orange.

words.defineEn: more suitable or effective compared to other available options
words.defineVi: phù hợp hơn hoặc hiệu quả hơn so với các tùy chọn có sẵn khác

examples: The customer isn't there, we have to bring forward the voice of the customer.

words.defineVi: để đề nghị hoặc giới thiệu một cái gì đó để thảo luận hoặc xem xét

examples: Good wine can make a meal.

Daytime temperatures can reach 40°C.
words.defineEn: used to present an offer or suggestion
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để trình bày một đề nghị hoặc đề nghị

examples: The unexpected challenges became grist for the mill of their problem-solving skills.
Are you up to the challenge?
They faced many challenges, but eventually made it to the other side.
It can be challenging to abstract complex concepts into simple explanations.
It can be challenging for someone from a different socioeconomic background to fit into an affluent community.
words.defineEn: an invitation that provokes or calls out someone to engage in a contest or an argument
words.defineVi: một lời mời khiêu khích hoặc kêu gọi ai đó tham gia vào một cuộc thi hoặc tranh luận

examples: The unexpected challenges became grist for the mill of their problem-solving skills.
Are you up to the challenge?
They faced many challenges, but eventually made it to the other side.
It can be challenging to abstract complex concepts into simple explanations.

words.defineVi: mời ai đó tham gia một cuộc thi; đề nghị mạnh mẽ rằng ai đó nên làm một điều gì đó, đặc biệt là khi họ có vẻ không muốn

examples: Not everyone likes the connotation.

When people hear the word developer, it has a certain connotation that might not necessarily be all that positive.
Frankincense and myrrh are perhaps best known for their biblical connotations.
They were much more likely to think the word’s connotation was its most disgusting trait.
words.defineEn: a feeling or an idea suggested by a word aside from its literal or primary meaning
words.defineVi: một cảm giác hoặc một ý tưởng được gợi ý bởi một từ ngoài nghĩa đen hoặc nghĩa chính của nó

examples: What does it connote?
The smooth surface of the carved, painted wood connotes cleanliness and health, with the triangular brass ornaments reflecting light and adding to its radiance when danced.
words.defineEn: to implicitly convey something such as an idea, feeling, etc. in addition to its basic meaning
words.defineVi: để ngầm truyền đạt một cái gì đó như một ý tưởng, cảm giác, vv ngoài ý nghĩa cơ bản của nó

examples: Two could play at that game, smart guy.

examples: If you enjoy solving puzzles and riddles, this escape room experience will float your boat.

I love lying on the grass and watching the clouds float across the sky.

examples: Most home givers aren't receiving hazard pay.

words.defineEn: to state an opinion, guess, suggestion, etc. even though there are chances of one being wrong
words.defineVi: để đưa ra một ý kiến, phỏng đoán, gợi ý, v.v. mặc dù có khả năng sai

examples: We have included some hints for beginners in this section.

The carob-covered almonds provided a delightful crunch and a hint of sweetness in every bite.
words.defineEn: to indirectly suggest something
words.defineVi: để gián tiếp đề nghị một cái gì đó

words.defineVi: một gợi ý nhỏ hoặc một lời khuyên cho thấy một vấn đề được giải quyết như thế nào

words.defineEn: used to inquire information about someone or something
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để hỏi thông tin về một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: A follow-up study in 2008 hypothesized that the connection had to do with the amount of light at night rather than with the actual phase of the moon.
The researchers hypothesized that the pregnant ewes had snacked on poisonous birth defect-causing plants.
The researchers hypothesize that this ongoing eruption could have been fed by a plume of magma from the Martian mantle.
One team hypothesized that the difference might be partially caused by the interactions between Venus’s thick atmosphere and its hot nightmare of a surface.
So the researcher hypothesized that, maybe, the elephant was using the plant the same way.
words.defineEn: to make an educational guess or to present a theory or assumption one is not sure about
words.defineVi: để đưa ra một phỏng đoán giáo dục hoặc trình bày một lý thuyết hoặc giả định mà người ta không chắc chắn về

examples: ideas that are light-years ahead of their time

examples: Those implicit memories also use different brain systems than other kinds.

words.defineEn: able to suggest without directly mentioning
words.defineVi: có thể gợi ý mà không đề cập trực tiếp

examples: Obviously, implicitly this carbon had another hydrogen that we are not showing.

words.defineEn: in a way that is suggested without being directly or clearly expressed
